newsitem.title: USA: NGFA, GE unit to offer grain trade software.
newsitem.headline: NGFA, GE unit to offer grain trade software.

text.p: National Grain and Feed Association (NGFA) Wednesday said it has teamed up with a General Electric Co unit to offer software and a network that will enable grain companies to do more business electronically.
The trade association said the software, which will be available in December, will allow companies to transmit inspection certificates and bills of lading electronically.
It said upgrades of the software, to be released later in 1997, will allow electronic settlement of feed grain, feed, feed ingredients and other grain products transactions.
NGFA said in addition to the software, GE Information Services Inc will provide a network to route and protect the integrity of information.

NGFA said the customized software will have a price tag of $895 for members and $1,595 for non-members. It said the fee for the network was not set but would likely be based on cost per document and would be signficantly less than mailing.
It said the new technology would provide a standardized electronic format for key grain transactions, cut down on paperwork and reduce the chance for human error.
